title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 155.6 - Emergency or unusual conditions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 155.6 - Emergency or unusual conditions

State Regulations

The Commissioner of Transportation may, by the erection of
signs, signals or other traffic control devices, alter or modify the provisions
of this Part to adequately protect the public at locations where emergency or
unusual conditions occur or exist as a result of the construction or
reconstruction on a restricted highway. These alterations or modifications
shall have the same force and effect as though they were specifically set forth
in this Part and shall remain in force until the condition is considered by the
commissioner to be safe and the erected signs, signals or other traffic control
devices have been officially removed. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
155.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
